Package com.github.tommyettinger.anim8

Class FastPNG8

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.PNG8
com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.FastPNG8
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable, AnimationWriter, Dithered
public class FastPNG8 extends PNG8
PNG-8 encoder with compression; can write animated and non-animated PNG images in indexed-mode. An instance can be reused to encode multiple PNGs with minimal allocation. This is a subclass of PNG8 that defaults to using a FastPalette when possible. An instance can be reused to encode multiple PNGs with minimal allocation.
You can configure the target palette and how this can dither colors via the PNG8.palette field, which is a PaletteReducer object (almost always a FastPalette) that defaults to null and can be reused. If you assign a PaletteReducer to palette, the methods PaletteReducer.exact(Color[]) or PaletteReducer.analyze(Pixmap) can be used to make the target palette match a specific set of colors or the colors in an existing image. If palette is null, this will compute a palette for each PNG that closely fits its set of given animation frames. If the palette isn't an exact match for the colors used in an animation (indexed mode has at most 256 colors), this will dither pixels so that from a distance, they look closer to the original colors. You can us PaletteReducer.setDitherStrength(float) to reduce (or increase) dither strength, typically between 0 and 2; the dithering algorithm used here by default is based on Burkes error-diffusion dithering but with patterns broken up using blue noise and the R2 sequence (Dithered.DitherAlgorithm.WREN), but you can select alternatives with PNG8.setDitherAlgorithm(DitherAlgorithm), such as the slow but high-quality Knoll Ordered Dither using Dithered.DitherAlgorithm.PATTERN, or no dither at all with Dithered.DitherAlgorithm.NONE.
This defaults to using a relatively low amount of compression, which makes the files this writes larger. You can use PNG8.setCompression(int) to lower compression from the default of 2, down to 1 or 0, or raise it to PNG8's default of 6 or as high as 9. Unlike PNG8, writing with compression level 0 can be much faster than even compression level 1, but the files are as large as they can get. If the PNG files are intended to be recompressed anyway (with the same DEFLATE algorithm), which is the case if a file will go in a JAR or ZIP archive, then using 0 compression may make sense, because DEFLATE applied twice is about the same as if applied once.
Note that for many cases where you write a non-animated PNG, you will want to use PNG8.writePrecisely(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean) instead of PNG8.write(FileHandle, Pixmap, boolean, boolean), since writePrecisely will attempt to reproduce the exact colors if there are 256 colors or less in the Pixmap, and will automatically change to calling write() if there are more than 256 colors.
From LibGDX in the class PixmapIO, with modifications to support indexed-mode files, dithering, animation, etc.

  • Method Details

    • write

      public void write(OutputStream output, com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap pixmap, boolean computePalette, boolean dither, int threshold)
      Writes the pixmap to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given Pixmap. If PNG8.palette is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will compute a palette from the given Pixmap regardless of computePalette. This does not consider the ditherStrength set in the palette, if non-null, but does use the PNG8.getDitherStrength() here.
      Overrides:
      write in class PNG8
      Parameters:
      output - an OutputStream that will not be closed
      pixmap - a Pixmap to write to the given output stream
      computePalette - if true, this will analyze the Pixmap and use the most common colors
      dither - true if this should dither colors that can't be represented exactly
      threshold - the analysis threshold to use if computePalette is true (min 0, practical max is over 100000)

    • write

      public void write(OutputStream output, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames, int fps, boolean dither)
      Description copied from class: PNG8
      Writes the Pixmaps to the stream without closing the stream, optionally computing an 8-bit palette from the given Pixmaps. If PNG8.palette is null (the default unless it has been assigned a PaletteReducer value), this will compute a palette from all of the frames given. Otherwise, this uses the colors already in PNG8.palette. Optionally dithers the result if dither is true, using the dither algorithm selected with PNG8.setDitherAlgorithm(DitherAlgorithm) (or Dithered.DitherAlgorithm.PATTERN if not set). This does not consider the ditherStrength set in the palette, if non-null, but does use the PNG8.getDitherStrength() here.
      Overrides:
      write in class PNG8
      Parameters:
      output - an OutputStream that will not be closed
      frames - a Pixmap Array to write as a sequence of frames to the given output stream
      fps - how many frames per second the animation should run at
      dither - true if this should use PNG8.getDitherAlgorithm() to dither; false to not dither
